newsitem.title: CANADA: WCE canola, flax end down on late local selling.
newsitem.headline: WCE canola, flax end down on late local selling.

text.p: WCE canola and flax futures ended lower on late local selling met by commercial demand.

"XCan bought November all day. Cargill covered January and November shorts, crushers bought August at $348 and locals sold late," a canola trader said. November WCE futures crush margin fell to -7.92 Thursday from -4.64 Wednesday. Aug-Mar spread at $1.

August canola lost $2.10 to close at $349.60 and November fell $2.50 to $340.20. July flax fell $9.50 to $330.50 on local selling as commercials covered shorts scale down. September flax fell $7 to a new low of $279.50.

RBC-DS covered July western barley shorts at the close up $0.60 at $125.20 but good growing weather and hedges pushed new crop October down $1.90 to $122.60. December lost $1.30 to end at $124.30. July-Oct spread at even money.
Commercials sold October feed wheat down $1.60 to $148.80, December fell $1.70 to $149 on commission houses. UGG sold 50 Oct-Dec at even money, July-Oct spread at $4.
Peas and oats did not trade.
(All values in Canadian dollars per tonne except oats, peas.)
